text: Need more songs from this game or Gust in general on your list. They are so underrated it's criminal.

text: This piece suits an endgame world map, where you've beaten everything before you and now just have one final challenge lying in front of you.
author: InBloom Video

text: i like it. reminds me of Nier's music.
author: FireKirby7

text:
I have finished Ar Tonelico I and II and currently playing III all because of the OST: I found the music to be so beautiful, so fantastic, so magical that I decided I had to play it and let me tell ya, a brand new copy of the first Ar Tonelico is not cheap but it was worth it, so worth it.
I honestly can't wait for this one, I can only hope it's translated to english but even if it isn't, I must play it.
author: Bruno Santos

text: haven't heard of game before but instantly recognized it being related to the Ar Tonelico series.  Good to see their still making games and now can hope they'll localize this game someday crosses fingers
author: fatjoe460

text: My immediate thought on what genre the game is after searching it's name in Google Images: Bikini Dress-Up Simulator.
author: Jirt

text: What the fuck I shouldn't have google that at work. Now I look like a huge perv. :-\
author: C_Clop

text: I wouldn't call this music just solid, but that's me. I think it's incredible both this and Ar Tonelico.
author: Alon Jacovi

text: This is a prequel to Ar tonelico, it came out recently in Japan but I'm not sure this one will make it here since the series is very niche. It always has solid music though, the Gust sound team really developed its own recognizable style. I have no idea if this game is actually any good though.
author: SupraDarky

text: I doubt it will come here to North America.  Although, this series does have some really good music.  Achiwa is actually a pretty underrated composer.  I like the works he has done.  I'll have to listen to more soundtracks from this series.
author: Eric C.

text: It had it's own uniqueness in terms of the maiden system, but other than that it was like any other rpg. Still fun.
author: Jeffrey Garcia

text: Just finished all 5 games. And holy shit the music level in these is insane. Nothing comes even close. 1,2,3 and 5 are in english. 4th will never be released with english translation, but there is fan project on youtube that lets you experience the story of the game in english. Playing Ar Nosurge without knowing what happened in Ciel no surge is just silly stupid.
author: Eksistenssi
